resources.string: 30Days Coding
HTML - Structure of Web Pages

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn the basics of HTML, including elements, attributes, and document structure.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Practice by creating a simple webpage with headings, paragraphs, and images.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Work on forms and tables to understand data input in HTML.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
CSS - Styling Your Web Pages

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Understand CSS basics: selectors, properties, and values.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Learn about the box model and positioning elements.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Implement responsive design with flexbox and grid.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
JavaScript - Programming for the Web

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn JavaScript basics: variables, data types, and operators.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Practice control structures: loops and conditionals.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Understand functions and event handling in JavaScript.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Python - Basics of Programming

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn about variables, data types, and basic operators.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Work with lists, tuples, and dictionaries.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Understand control flow: loops and conditionals.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
SQL - Managing Databases

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn SQL syntax and basic queries.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Work with CRUD operations.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Learn about relationships and joins in SQL.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Java - Object-Oriented Programming

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Introduction to Java syntax and structure.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Learn about classes, objects, and methods.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Explore inheritance and polymorphism.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
C# - Basics and OOP

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Understand C# syntax and structure.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Work with variables, loops, and conditionals.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Learn about classes, objects, and methods.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
React - JavaScript Framework

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Introduction to React concepts.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Create components and props.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Implement state and lifecycle methods.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Node.js - Backend Development

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn about Node.js and package management.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Work with Express.js for creating a simple server.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Implement routing and middleware.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Advanced Java Concepts

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn about multithreading, exception handling, and file handling.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Work with threading and exception handling in Java.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Implement a multithreading project.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning. Try platforms like [HackerRank](https://www.hackerrank.com/) and [LeetCode](https://leetcode.com/).
PHP - Server-Side Programming

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn PHP basics: syntax, variables, and data types.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Work with forms, sessions, and cookies.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Implement a simple login system with PHP.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning. Try platforms like W3Schools and PHP Quiz.
Laravel - PHP Framework

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Introduction to Laravel and MVC architecture.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Work with routes, controllers, and views.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Create a simple CRUD application in Laravel.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz. Try Laravel documentation and Codecademy.
C++ - Fundamentals and OOP

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn C++ syntax, variables, and control structures.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Work with functions, pointers, and arrays.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Implement a mini project using OOP concepts.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Advanced C++ Concepts

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Explore advanced C++ topics like STL and file handling.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Implement a project using advanced C++ concepts.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Debugging techniques in C++.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Data Structures - Arrays and Lists

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Introduction to arrays and list data structures.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Implement operations on arrays and lists.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Learn about array manipulation algorithms (e.g., sorting, searching).
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Algorithms - Sorting and Searching

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn about common sorting algorithms (Bubble Sort, Merge Sort, etc.).
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Work on searching algorithms (Binary Search, Linear Search).
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Implement and compare different sorting and searching algorithms.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Version Control - Git and GitHub

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn Git basics: initializing repositories, commits, and branches.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Work with GitHub: creating repositories, pushing and pulling changes.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Practice collaborative workflows with Git (fork, pull requests, merges).
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Web Development - HTTP and APIs

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Understand HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) and status codes.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Learn how APIs work and interact with a simple API.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Build a simple API using Express.js (or Flask for Python).
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Frontend Frameworks - React

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Dive deeper into React: useState, useEffect, and component lifecycle.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Learn how to manage state in React applications.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Build a simple React app (e.g., to-do list, weather app).
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Backend Development - Node.js and Express

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn about Node.js environment and npm (node package manager).
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Work with Express.js to create RESTful APIs.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Implement routing, middleware, and error handling.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Database Design - SQL and NoSQL

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn the difference between SQL and NoSQL databases.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Work with SQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL).
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Learn about NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB).
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Security - Authentication and Authorization

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn the difference between authentication and authorization.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Implement authentication (JWT, OAuth).
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Implement authorization in an API using roles.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Testing - Unit Testing and TDD

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Introduction to unit testing and Test-Driven Development (TDD).
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Write unit tests for functions in JavaScript or Python.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Learn about testing frameworks (e.g., Jest, Mocha, PyTest).
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Performance Optimization - Caching and Load Balancing

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn about caching techniques and when to use them.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Work with Redis for caching in Node.js.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Understand the concepts of load balancing and horizontal scaling.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Cloud Computing - AWS or Azure

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Introduction to cloud computing and major cloud providers (AWS, Azure).
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Deploy a simple app to AWS EC2 or Azure App Service.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Work with cloud storage and databases in the cloud.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
DevOps - CI/CD and Automation

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn about Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD).
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Set up a simple CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions or Jenkins.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Automate deployments with Docker and Kubernetes.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Mobile App Development - React Native or Flutter

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Introduction to React Native or Flutter for mobile app development.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Build a simple mobile app (e.g., to-do list, weather app).
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Learn about mobile-specific design patterns and UI components.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Agile Development and Scrum

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn the fundamentals of Agile development.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Understand Scrum methodology and roles.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Practice creating user stories and managing a Scrum board.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Soft Skills - Communication and Teamwork

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Learn the importance of communication in development teams.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Practice effective communication skills (listening, clarity, conciseness).
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Work on conflict resolution and teamwork in collaborative settings.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Quick review of the concepts learned.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Take a short quiz to reinforce learning.
Final Project - Full Stack Application

• 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Plan and structure your final full stack application project.
 • 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Work on implementing the frontend and backend of the project.
 • 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM: Complete testing, documentation, and deployment.
 • 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM: Present the final project.
 • 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Celebrate and reflect on the 30-day journey!
